name: Black 2
wip: Finish requirements. Add console wares. Create event simulator and progress importer. Add interactive map. Improve the guide.
advices: The hardest element is the Starf Berry which requires 203 consecutive Battle Subway wins. Check https://github.com/RainingChain/PokemonB2W2BattleSubwayRNG for guidance for Battle Subway and Battle Institute.

Join Avenue Level 100 is very long but it generates a lot of money. Add Market shops to your avenue and upon reaching level 10 on each shop, there will be a sale for 1 week. Buy all EV-items (ex: Protein) and sell them back to the Pokémart for about 2M $ profit. This can be repeated.

Black Entralink Entree level 100 is also long. Best way to level it up is by doing the Find Lost Items! Lvl 1 funfest mission and going to Castelia. Make sure to get a score of at least 11. (Getting score of 10 gives 1 exp, while above 10 gives the score as exp.) You need about 5000 exp for lvl 100.
Another long element is getting Pokérus (medal) but it can be RNG-abused.

For the medal 10 Followers, you'll need to win 130+ times the musical. To win easily, do Stardom muscial and wear Cowboy Hat, Fake Belly Button, Black Wings, Toy Sword, Toy Cutlass, Fluffy Beard, Small Barrette, Pink Barrette. No need to appeal to win. Credits: Mikey_R
Make sure to RNG the legendaries for perfect IV and nature, especially Latios and Terrakion which are very good for Battle Subway.
If aiming for true 100%, you'll need to get all Pokémon forms, including all shiny forms. Make sure to RNG manipulate your secret trainer id when starting your new game.
Check Black 2 Foreign Pokédex Entries Guide

missables.text: You must pick the starter Snivy or Oshawott in order to obtain the maximum number of medals. With Snivy, you can obtain Grass-type Catcher medal. With Oshawott, you can obtain Water-type Catcher medal. With Tepig, you can't obtain Fire-type Catcher medal because of missing Reshiram.

list.name: First Step
list.location: A Medal given to all Medal Rally participants at the beginning. A symbol of a Trainer's potential.

list.name: Participation Prize
list.location: Go to the Medal Office after collecting 50 Medals. A Medal for Medal Rally participants who achieved certain results and reached a goal.

list.name: Rookie Medalist
list.location: Obtain Rookie Rank by collecting 50 Medals. A Medal commemorating the advance to the Rookie Rank as the result of constant efforts in the Medal Rally.

list.name: Elite Medalist
list.location: Obtain Elite Rank by collecting 100 Medals. A Medal commemorating the advance to the Elite Rank as the result of constant efforts in the Medal Rally.

list.name: Master Medalist
list.location: Obtain Master Rank by collecting 150 Medals. A Medal commemorating the advance to the Master Rank as the result of constant efforts in the Medal Rally.

list.name: Legend Medalist
list.location: Obtain Legend Rank by collecting 200 Medals. A Medal commemorating the advance to the Legend Rank as the result of constant efforts in the Medal Rally.

list.name: Top Medalist
list.location: An honorable Medal for those who collected all the Medals.

list.name: Hint Medal
list.location: Does not count towards total. Obtained from Mr. Medal, contains hints towards how to get new Medals.

list.name: Light Walker
list.location: A Medal to praise light walkers who took 5,000 steps on the land of Unova.

list.name: Middle Walker
list.location: A Medal to praise middle walkers who took 10,000 steps on the land of Unova.

list.name: Heavy Walker
list.location: A Medal to praise heavy walkers who took 20,000 steps on the land of Unova.

list.name: Honored Footprints
list.location: A Medal to praise ultimate walkers who took 100,000 steps on the land of Unova.

list.name: Step-by-Step Saver
list.location: A Medal to recognize a newly started journey that has been recorded 10 times.

list.name: Busy Saver
list.location: A Medal to recognize an energetic journey that has been recorded 20 times.

list.name: Experienced Saver
list.location: A Medal to recognize a smooth journey that has been recorded 50 times.

list.name: Wonder Writer
list.location: A Medal to recognize an astonishing journey that has been recorded 100 times.

list.name: Pokémon Center Fan
list.location: Restore Pokémon's health in Pokémon Centers 10 times. A Medal given to kind Trainers who let their Pokémon rest at Pokémon Centers many times.

list.name: Signboard Starter
list.location: A Medal for those who are very keen to collect information and checked five Trainer Tips signs.

list.name: Signboard Savvy
list.location: A Medal for those who have mastered the art of collecting information and checked 15 Trainer Tips signs.

list.name: Graffiti Gazer
list.location: Find graffiti behind a sign (north end of Route 2). A Medal to recognize the keen observation of Trainers who even noticed graffiti behind signs.

list.name: Starter Cycling
list.location: A Medal given to beginning cyclists who rode a Bicycle for the first time.

list.name: Easy Cycling
list.location: A Medal given to casual cyclists who have ridden a Bicycle 30 times.

list.name: Hard Cycling
list.location: A Medal given to outstanding cyclists who have ridden a Bicycle 100 times.

list.name: Pedaling Legend
list.location: A Medal given to earthshaking cyclists who have ridden a Bicycle 500 times.

list.name: Old Rod Fisherman
list.location: The player has only to reel in Pokémon, not catch it. A Medal given to beginning fishers who caught a Pokémon for the first time.

list.name: Good Rod Fisherman
list.location: The player has only to reel in Pokémon, not catch it. A Medal given to leisure fishers who caught 10 Pokémon.

list.name: Super Rod Fisherman
list.location: The player has only to reel in Pokémon, not catch it. A Medal given to very experienced fishers who caught 50 Pokémon.

list.name: Mighty Fisher
list.location: The player has only to reel in Pokémon, not catch it. A Medal given to legendary fishers who caught 100 Pokémon.

list.name: Normal-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Normal-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex. (Excluding Meloetta)

list.name: Fire-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Fire-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex. (Excluding Victini)

list.name: Water-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Water-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex. (Excluding Keldeo)

list.name: Electric-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Electric-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Grass-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Grass-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Ice-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Ice-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Fighting-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Fighting-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex. (Excluding Keldeo)

list.name: Poison-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Poison-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Ground-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Ground-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Flying-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Flying-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Psychic-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Psychic-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex. (Excluding Victini, Meloetta)

list.name: Bug-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Bug-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex. (Excluding Genesect)

list.name: Rock-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Rock-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Ghost-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Ghost-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Dragon-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Dragon-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Dark-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Dark-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex.

list.name: Steel-type Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of catching all the Steel-type Pokémon in the Unova Pokédex. (Excluding Genesect)

list.name: Unova Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of receiving the award from the Game Director for completing the Unova Pokédex. (Excluding Victini, Keldeo, Meloetta, Genesect)

list.name: National Catcher
list.location: A Medal in commemoration of receiving the award from the Game Director for completing the National Pokédex. (Excluding Mew, Lugia, Ho-Oh, Celebi, Jirachi, Deoxys, Phione, Manaphy, Darkrai, Shaymin, Arceus, Victini, Keldeo, Meloetta, Genesect)

list.name: 30 Boxed
list.location: A Medal given to novice Trainers who have deposited 30 Pokémon in their PC Boxes.

list.name: 120 Boxed
list.location: A Medal given to skilled Trainers who have deposited 120 Pokémon in their PC Boxes.

list.name: 360 Boxed
list.location: A Medal given to highly skilled Trainers who have deposited 360 Pokémon in their PC Boxes.

list.name: Boxes Max
list.location: Deposit 720 Pokémon into PC boxes. A Medal given to Trainers of high caliber who have caught enough Pokémon to fill all their PC Boxes.

list.name: Capturing Spree
list.location: A Medal for those who caught 50 Pokémon in a day.

list.name: Vending Virtuoso
list.location: A Medal for thirsty Trainers who bought 10 or more drinks at vending machines.

list.name: Lucky Drink
list.location: Get a bonus drink from a vending machine. A Medal for lucky people who got a bonus at a vending machine.

list.name: Evolution Hopeful
list.location: A Medal for promising Trainers who evolved a Pokémon for the first time.

list.name: Evolution Tech
list.location: A Medal for skilled Trainers who evolved Pokémon 10 times and are recognized by even Pokémon Breeders.

list.name: Evolution Expert
list.location: A Medal for great Trainers who evolved Pokémon 50 times, which surprised even the Day-Care Man.

list.name: Evolution Authority
list.location: A Medal for exceptional Trainers who evolved Pokémon 100 times, which astounds even Pokémon Professors.

list.name: Ace Pilot
list.location: Travel using Fly 20 times. A Medal for those who flew all over the Unova sky using Fly.

list.name: Hustle Muscle
list.location: Use Strength to drop a large boulder 20 times. A Medal to praise the strength of Trainers who moved many boulders out of their way.

list.name: Trash Master
list.location: Check empty trash cans 10 times. A Medal for curiosity seekers who checked trash cans even though they knew they were empty.

list.name: Dowsing Beginner
list.location: A Medal to praise sharp-eyed Trainers who found a hidden item for the first time.

list.name: Dowsing Specialist
list.location: A Medal to praise sharp-eyed Trainers who found 10 hidden items.

list.name: Dowsing Collector
list.location: A Medal to praise sharp-eyed Trainers who found 50 hidden items.

list.name: Dowsing Wizard
list.location: A Medal to praise peerlessly sharp-eyed Trainers who found 150 hidden items.

list.name: Naming Champ
list.location: Give nicknames to Pokémon 10 times.. A Medal given to those who gave many nicknames to Pokémon.

list.name: Television Kid
list.location: Watch television 10 times. A Medal given to today's children who get absorbed in television and can't help watching it.

list.name: Regular Customer
list.location: Make 100 purchases at shops. A Medal for Trainers who kept going to various shops and became regular customers.

list.name: Moderate Customer
list.location: A Medal for rich people who spent 10,000$ at various shops.

list.name: Great Customer
list.location: A Medal for rich people who spent 100,000$ at various shops.

list.name: Indulgent Customer
list.location: A Medal for rich people who spent 1,000,000$ at various shops.

list.name: Super Rich
list.location: A Medal for super-rich people who spent 10,000,000$ at various shops.

list.name: Smart Shopper
list.location: Buy 10 or more Poké Balls at once and receive a Premier Ball. A Medal for thrifty shoppers who made bulk purchases and got bonus Premier Balls.

list.name: Sweet Home
list.location: Take a rest at home. A Medal for those who love their hometown and went home to rest and revisit old memories.

list.name: The First Passerby
list.location: Pass by a person for the first time with Tag Mode (C-Gear). A Medal commemorating a small encounter and farewell with the first passerby.

list.name: 30 Passersby
list.location: All passersby do not have to be different.. A Medal commemorating busy encounters and farewells with 30 passersby.

list.name: 100 Passersby
list.location: All passersby do not have to be different.. A Medal commemorating turbulent encounters and farewells with 100 passersby.

list.name: Heavy Traffic
list.location: All passersby do not have to be different.. A Medal commemorating the extraordinary human dramas of 1,000 passersby.

list.name: Pass Power 1
list.location: A Medal to recognize a new current of power in using a Pass Power for the first time.

list.name: Pass Power 2
list.location: A Medal to recognize a strong current of power in using 10 Pass Powers.

list.name: Pass Power 3
list.location: A Medal to recognize a fierce current of power in using 50 Pass Powers.

list.name: Pass Power MAX
list.location: A Medal to recognize an ultimate current of power in using 100 Pass Powers.

list.name: Dozing Capture
list.location: A Medal for daydreamers who caught a Pokémon for the first time in the Entree Forest.

list.name: Sleeping Capture
list.location: A Medal for daydreamers who caught 10 Pokémon in the Entree Forest.

list.name: Deep Sleep Capture
list.location: A Medal for daydreamers who caught 50 Pokémon in the Entree Forest.

list.name: Sweet Dreamer
list.location: A dreamy Medal for those who caught 100 Pokémon in the Entree Forest.

list.name: Hidden Grotto Adept
list.location: A Medal to praise the wild nature of people who found all the Hidden Grottoes.

list.name: Egg Beginner
list.location: A Medal to prove the fresh parental instincts of people who hatched a Pokémon Egg for the first time.

list.name: Egg Breeder
list.location: A Medal to prove the decent parental instincts of people who hatched 10 Pokémon Eggs.

list.name: Egg Elite
list.location: A Medal to prove the outstanding parental instincts of people who hatched 50 Pokémon Eggs.

list.name: Hatching Aficionado
list.location: A Medal to prove the endless parental instincts of people who hatched 100 Pokémon Eggs.

list.name: Day-Care Faithful
list.location: Leave 100 Pokémon at the Pokémon Day Care on Unova. A Medal for those who love to raise Pokémon and left many Pokémon at the Pokémon Day Care.

list.name: Archeology Lover
list.location: Have a Pokémon Fossil restored at the Nacrene Museum. A Medal to prove the power of science that restored Pokémon from Fossils and brought them to the present time.

list.name: Pure Youth
list.location: Catch requires Memory Link. A Medal for those who befriended a Pokémon of the Trainer who was recognized by the legendary Pokémon.

list.name: Lucky Color
list.location: A Medal to praise the luck of people who have befriended a Shiny Pokémon.

list.name: Pokérus Discoverer
list.location: A Medal given to Trainers whose Pokémon were infected with the mysterious Pokérus.

list.name: Castelia Boss
list.location: Defeat the three Trainers on Back Street in Castelia City. A Medal for those who became the leader of the pack in Castelia City.

list.name: Rail Enthusiast
list.location: A Medal for rail enthusiasts who heard information on all the trains in Anville Town.

list.name: Wailord Watcher
list.location: A Medal for those who had the rare sight of a Wailord swimming past the Marine Tube.

list.name: Face Board Memorial
list.location: A Medal for those who took a commemorative photo at the face board in Humilau City.

list.name: Heavy Machinery Pro
list.location: Correctly answer the Heavy Machinery Pro's five questions in Twist Mountain. A Medal for mavens who know everything about construction trucks.

list.name: Ruins Raider
list.location: A Medal given to explorers who have reached the deepest part of the Abyssal Ruins.

list.name: Diamond Dust
list.location: A Medal given to people who have seen the rare diamond dust.

list.name: Bridge Enthusiast
list.location: A Medal for bridge enthusiasts who visited all the bridges in the Unova region.

list.name: Around Unova
list.location: A Medal given to great travelers who have visited every city and town in the Unova region. (This includes Unity Tower which requires making an international trade)

list.name: Great Adventurer
list.location: A Medal to reward people who collected all the Adventure Medals.

list.name: Battle Learner
list.location: A Medal for courageous young Trainers who went through 100 battles.

list.name: Battle Teacher
list.location: A Medal for ferociously courageous Trainers who went through 200 battles.

list.name: Battle Veteran
list.location: A Medal for tremendously courageous Trainers who went through 400 battles.

list.name: Battle Virtuoso
list.location: A Medal for peerlessly courageous Trainers who went through 2,000 battles.

list.name: Link Battle Amateur
list.location: A Medal to praise the fresh competitive spirit of Trainers who had a Link Battle for the first time.

list.name: Link Battle Pioneer
list.location: A Medal to praise the advanced competitive spirit of Trainers who had 10 Link Battles.

list.name: Link Battle Expert
list.location: A Medal to praise the sophisticated competitive spirit of Trainers who had 50 Link Battles.

list.name: Born to Battle
list.location: A Medal to praise the impressive competitive spirit of Trainers who had 100 Link Battles.

list.name: Magikarp Award
list.location: Use Splash once. A Medal to praise the guts of Trainers who kept using Splash no matter what.

list.name: Never Give Up
